attributes.action: MP's to respect result of the Referendum to Leave the EU else resign immediately
attributes.additional_details:
We, the people of the United Kingdom, have other priorities requiring government and Parliament to focus their time and attention on besides Brexit.

We demand that all MP's, regardless of personal views or party, negotiate and agree to a deal that is in the interests of the UK, or agree to respect the law and leave the EU without a deal, and in any case on or before the 31st October 2019, or tender your resignation effective immediately as we the people have no confidence in you to represent us
attributes.background: On the 23rd June 2016 a referendum was held for the people of the UK to decide if we Remain members of the EU or Leave the EU. Since then, the Government have tried to agree a deal with the EU that would be acceptable to Parliament, without success. The default position in Law is to Leave regardless

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for removing MPs from office because of their views or opinions. 

You might like to sign this petition: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/257347
